Education

PSL University — Paris, France

March 2023 – February 2026
  • Ph.D in Artificial Intelligence
  • Joint research agreement between PSL University and Thales under the supervision of Prof. Tristan Cazenave.
  • Research topic: Optimizing the trade-off between neural network performance and complexity for radar target detection.

Paris Dauphine – PSL University — Paris, France

  • Master’s degree – Artificial Intelligence, Systems, Data (IASD)
  • September 2021 – June 2022
  • Graduated with 1st class honours (15.95/20) and ranked 2nd out of 25 students.
  • Relevant coursework: Deep learning, NLP, Optimization, Graph mining, Machine learning, etc.
  • Master’s thesis: Deep learning applied to radar target detection.

Work Experience

Ph.D AI Research Scientist — Thales, Elancourt, France

  • March 2023 – February 2026
  • Responsible for investigating resource-efficient neural network design for the problem of airborne radar target detection.
  • Developed solutions for designing efficient convolutional neural networks in resource-constrained contexts for implementation in operational radar systems.
  • Scientific contributions to AI-driven radar signal processing and to multi-objective optimization, illustrated by first-author papers at international conferences.

Apprentice AI Radar Engineer — Thales, Elancourt, France

  • September 2021 – September 2022
  • Responsible for the development and implementation of deep learning algorithms applied to radar target detection.
  • Trained CNNs for target detection on extremely low SNRs (signal-noise ratio).
  • Improved the technology readiness level of the developed algorithm towards operational deployment.

Co‑founder — DeepClimb, Paris, France

  • February 2020 – January 2022
  • Co-founded a R&D-oriented startup bringing machine learning innovation to the field of indoor boulder climbing.
  • Responsible for the development, training and deployment of state‑of‑the‑art deep learning algorithms in object detection, sequence generation, autoencoding, image generation.
  • Raised $60k pre-seed funding for a $1M valuation.

Publications

  • Noé Lallouet, Tristan Cazenave and Cyrille Enderli. “Pareto‑NRPA: A Novel Monte‑Carlo Search Algorithm for Multi‑Objective Optimization.” ECAI 2025, IOS Press, https://doi.org/10.3233/faia251394.
  • Noé Lallouet, Tristan Cazenave, Cyrille Enderli and Stéphanie Gourdin. “Searching Efficient Deep Architectures for Radar Target Detection Using Monte‑Carlo Tree Search.” 2024 International Radar Conference (RADAR), IEEE, https://doi.org/10.1109/radar58436.2024.10993743.
  • Noé Lallouet, Tristan Cazenave, Cyrille Enderli and Stéphanie Gourdin. “Loss Function Design For Training Robust Radar Detectors Using Deep Learning.” Conference on Artificial Intelligence for Defense, DGA Maîtrise de l’Information, https://hal.science/hal-04328554v1.

Projects & Awards

Winner, Hackmakers Formula AI Hackathon — March 2022

  • Winner of a global three-day hackathon on the subject of weather prediction in Formula One with a prize pool of $60k+.
  • Placed first out of 140+ teams.

Runner‑up, Paris‑Dauphine Startup Challenge — January 2020

  • Award received following the presentation of a sports‑tech startup implementing deep learning solutions in the field of indoor boulder climbing.
